<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 419, 225, 435]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 435, 880, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 94, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 583, 102]]<|/det|>
The function f is defined by \(\operatorname {f}(x) = \frac{1}{3x + 2} +x^{2}\) for \(x< -1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 112, 751, 133]]<|/det|>
Determine whether f is an increasing function, a decreasing function or neither.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 112, 920, 131]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 646, 92]]<|/det|>
The graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) is transformed to the graph of \(y = 1 + \mathrm{f}\left(\frac{1}{2} x\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 103, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
Describe fully the two single transformations which have been combined to give the resulting transformation. [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[416, 84, 615, 324]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 344, 918, 380]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve with equation \(y = x^{2} + 1\). The shaded region enclosed by the curve, the \(y\)-axis and the line \(y = 5\) is rotated through \(360^{\circ}\) about the \(\mathbf{y}\) -axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 392, 331, 410]]<|/det|>
Find the volume obtained.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 392, 920, 411]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = x^{2} - 2x - 3\). A point is moving along the curve in such a way that at \(P\) the \(y\)-coordinate is increasing at 4 units per second and the \(x\)-coordinate is increasing at 6 units per second.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 336, 138]]<|/det|>
Find the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[349, 84, 687, 282]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 304, 920, 355]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a sector \(AOB\) which is part of a circle with centre \(O\) and radius \(6\mathrm{cm}\) and with angle \(AOB = 0.8\) radians. The point \(C\) on \(OB\) is such that \(AC\) is perpendicular to \(OB\). The arc \(CD\) is part of a circle with centre \(O\), where \(D\) lies on \(OA\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 365, 395, 384]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 367, 920, 384]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
A woman's basic salary for her first year with a particular company is \(\) 30,000\(and at the end of the year she also gets a bonus of\) \ \(600\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 120, 725, 139]]<|/det|>
For her first year, express her bonus as a percentage of her basic salary.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 121, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 298, 920, 332]]<|/det|>
At the end of each complete year, the woman's basic salary will increase by \(3\%\) and her bonus will increase by \(\) 100.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 344, 146, 363]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 344, 920, 377]]<|/det|>
Express the bonus she will be paid at the end of her 24th year as a percentage of the basic salary paid during that year.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 357, 920, 376]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 781, 92]]<|/det|>
Express \(2x^{2} + 12x + 11\) in the form \(2(x + a)^{2} + b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 475, 608, 495]]<|/det|>
The function f is defined by \(\operatorname {f}(x) = 2x^{2} + 12x + 11\) for \(x\leqslant - 4.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 509, 146, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 509, 620, 528]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\operatorname {f}^{-1}(x)\) and state the domain of \(\operatorname {f}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 509, 920, 528]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 405, 91]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 648, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(3\tan^{2}x - 5\tan x - 2 = 0\) for \(0^{\circ}\leqslant x\leqslant 180^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 611, 186, 630]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 611, 920, 630]]<|/det|>
Find the set of values of \(k\) for which the equation \(3\tan^{2}x - 5\tan x + k = 0\) has no solutions. [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(3\tan^{2}x - 5\tan x + k = 0\), state the value of \(k\) for which there are three solutions in the interval \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 180^{\circ}\), and find these solutions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 460, 92]]<|/det|>
The two circles intersect at points \(R\) and \(S\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 146, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 104, 586, 122]]<|/det|>
Show that the equation of the line \(RS\) is \(y = -2x + 13\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 611, 186, 630]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 611, 850, 630]]<|/det|>
Hence show that the \(x\)-coordinates of \(R\) and \(S\) satisfy the equation \(5x^{2} - 60x + 159 = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 610, 920, 628]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]
